page.title: 02BURWASH HIGH STREET
page.content: The High Street today has houses dating from the 16th century to modern times - and from large houses of wealthy Landowners, to traditional workman's cottages. It is interesting to note however, that the latter are now sold at an enormously high price - generally to retired people seeking the peace and tranquility of village life. An Old People's home, built in , on the site of the old rectory has been constructed architecturally in keeping with the other buildings on the High Street. There are three small council estates in the village, and a small development of bungalows at the East end.
